answers.answer: I have the same problem with my mom and I thought just ignoring her would be fine.  But like you I was consumed by guilt, plus whether or not I liked it, she was still my mom and there is still a bond there.  Now when I talk to her, and I make sure it is very limited because I already know all she is going to do is vent so I just let her and stop myself from trying to help her.  In the past I would get so involved and want to help her and then get mad when she didn't do what I suggested.  I realized I was being codependent, and that was my issue. As far as money, I am not sure if giving them it right now is helpful.  You are right, it will go to drugs, plus if they have money for their basic needs and instead using it for drugs, then your money could just be enabling their lifestyle.  It is so hard, I know.  You sound like you have a big heart and have already gone through so much.  Please make sure you have safe, caring people in your life as well, to help balance out the insanity with your parents. Most of all just remind yourself that what they are doing is their choice.  None of us are victims.

question: My father is a heroin addict.  My mother was a reformed alcoholic, now addicted to pain killers and won’t leave bed.  She is unwell – cannot walk, has diabetes, is going blind and will not leave the house.  There were elements of violence when I was younger but nothing really bad.  My parents have no interest in me, and we no longer talk.I have grown up in a ‘poor’ background where it was common to have no food, water or electricity.  I am now quite successful, but I don’t like giving my parents money because they just waste it on drugs.  At the same time I feel guilty because they need money for other things.I feel guilty for not talking to my mother but I cannot stand hearing her talk about what is wrong when I know she will not do anything about it and all my attempts have not worked well.I really need to know what to do, I can’t keep ignoring it and I can’t talk to my parents about it either they won’t acknowledge anything.  Has anyone dealt with this kind of situation before?  And what should be my best approach (i.e keep ignoring them?)
title: Addict parents
